articles.title: Apple loses bid to pause app store reform order in Epic Games case
articles.content: (Reuters) -Apple on Wednesday failed to persuade a U.S. appeals court to pause key parts of a federal judge's order requiring the iPhone maker to immediately open its lucrative App Store to more competition.  The 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals rejected Apple's request to put the provisions on hold as the tech company appeals the judge's order, which came in a long-running antitrust lawsuit brought by “Fortnite” maker Epic Games.  U.S. District Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers in April found Apple in contempt of an earlier injunction order she issued in the Epic Games case.

articles.title: A Prominent Tech Analyst Adds a New Role: Pitching a Stock Fund
articles.content: The IVES ETF includes 30 AI-focused tech stocks. It puts analyst Dan Ives in the unusual position of covering tech companies while pitching a fund full of their stocks.

articles.title: Apple WWDC 2025: What to expect
articles.content: Apple's 2025 Worldwide Developers Conference kicks off on Monday, June 9. The expectations are a bit muted this year, given the big AI announcements that came last year. In the video above, Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley shares what he will be watching from the big Apple (AAPL) event. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

articles.title: Amazon's AI investment, Guidewire, Apple: Trending Tickers
articles.content: Amazon (AMZN) will be expanding its AI infrastructure by investing $10 billion into its North Carolina data centers. Guidewire Software (GWRE) shares soar on its first quarter earnings beat, while also reporting sales growth to have increased by 22% year-over-year. Apple (AAPL) was downgraded from a Buy rating to Hold by Needham analysts. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

articles.title: Apple downgrade, Guidewire guidance, Thor Industries Q3 sales
articles.content: Yahoo Finance host Julie Hyman tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including Apple's (AAPL) downgrade to a Hold rating by Needham analysts, Guidewire Software (GWRE) raising its full-year revenue guidance, and RV manufacturer Thor Industries (THO) topping fiscal third quarter sales estimates in its latest earnings print. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
